body_html:
Yes this is possible,

By the way, bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles is a bit weird, we generally use $PYTHON_RUNFILES if it exisrts or $0.runfiles instead. Every other file should be included as inputs of the target. Seeing the build_pip_package.sh script I actually wonder why it is not a build step for bazel?

Yes this is possible,
By the way, bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles is a bit weird, we generally use $PYTHON_RUNFILES if it exisrts or $0.runfiles instead. Every other file should be included as inputs of the target. Seeing the build_pip_package.sh script I actually wonder why it is not a build step for bazel?
body:
Yes this is possible,

By the way, `bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles` is a bit weird, we generally use `$PYTHON_RUNFILES` if it exisrts or `$0.runfiles` instead. Every other file should be included as inputs of the target. Seeing the build_pip_package.sh script I actually wonder why it is not a build step for bazel?
